thread.title: Peppers Noosa launches, showcasing best in accommodation
thread.title_full: Peppers Noosa launches, showcasing best in accommodation

title: Peppers Noosa launches, showcasing best in accommodation
text:
Peppers Noosa launches, showcasing best in accommodation Michele Sternberg | 24th Sep 2015 8:11 AM A Grande Villa plunge pool at Peppers Noosa Resort. Contributed Local Real Estate Cars For Sale 
T HE newly-branded Peppers Noosa Resort was officially launched on Thursday, September 10, at a function that showcased "the very best the region has to offer". 
Lunch, featuring a range of local produce, was served to invited guests in a spectacular venue that had the ocean as a stunning backdrop. 
Peppers general manager Steve McPharlin, who is also the chairman of Tourism Noosa, said the region boasted a wide variety of outstanding produce. 
He welcomed the group of corporate clients and industry representatives to savour the local flavours, while taking in the unique Noosa setting. 
Celebrity chef and local produce champion Matt Golinski, Noosa Boathouse's executive chef Shane Bailey and Peppers Noosa Resort and Villas executive chef Michael Jenkins prepared the three-course lunch using the region's produce, including wagyu beef, fresh eggplant, cheese and berries. 
Shane whipped up a fresh entree of Fraser Island spanner crab, compressed watermelon, avocado and citrus with a prawn croquet, which was followed by Matt's spiced rump cap served on a bed of grilled eggplant with labneh, oxtail brink and a harissa sauce. 
Michael chose fresh local berries from a farm near Gympie which he matched with a vanilla and coconut pannacotta and parfait for dessert. 
Mantra Group officially took over management of four Outrigger Resorts in July, including Noosa's Outrigger Little Hastings Street Resort and Spa, now rebranded as Peppers Noosa Resort and Villas. noosa
